articles.title: Allison Koh
articles.contents:
Allison Koh
          
          
            
          
          
            
            I am a PhD Candidate at the Berlin Graduate School for Global and Transregional Studies and the Hertie School Centre for International Security. In my dissertation research, I study the consequences of state-sponsored cyberharassment campaigns on political violence and dissent. I am also a Research Associate at the Hertie School Data Science Lab and the SCRIPTS Data and Methodology Center. In this role, I develop data science learning resources and consult on statistical computing for graduate students and researchers.

articles.title: Willkommen!
articles.contents:
Willkommen!
          
          
            
          
          
            György Herzl is a filmmaker and computational storyteller based in Leipzig, Germany. Their work has been featured at the Festival do Rio, Internationale Filmfestspiele Berlin, Kunsthalle Basel, and the New Museum of Contemporary Art in New York City. “ГУМ” is their latest project which examines the rise of consumerism in post-Soviet republics.
